Html:
RootedAlgorithmBase.OnRooVertexChanged   has a typo..  I like kangaroos, but..

BidirectionalGraph.clone exists, yet no other GraphTypes have this.
Why not have all of them clonable?

Extension methods are not implemented on all graph types.  Why is this?

What might UndirectedBidirectionalGraph graph be used for? Sounds Contradictory to me.  It is directed or not,
but both?

Also, we need some XML docs in the code.  And some guidance on choosing an appropriate graph type
would be nice.

Thanks in advance

Can you open separate issues for each problem?

Algorithm care about wether a graph is directed or not. Thus, the difference.

Extension methods are defined on interfaces when it makes sense. Do you have particular examples?

Cloneable: yes, just lack of time.

Typo is a new issue.
Cloneable is a new issue
UndirectedGraph.RemoveVertex has a bug..  New Issue created.
